properties.verseOrder: v1 c1 v2 v3 v4 v5

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: The gypsy rover came over the hill, Bound through the valley so shady; He whistled and he sang till the green woods rang, And he won the heart of a lady.

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: Lah-Dee-o, Lah-Dee-O-ah-day, Lay-dee-o, Lah dee ay dee. He whistled and he sang until the green woods rang, And he won the heart of a lady. Each chorus follows similarly

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: She left her father's castle gate, She left her own true lover; She left her servants and her estate, To follow the gypsy rover.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Her father saddled his fastest steed, He roam'd the valley all over; He sought his daughter at great speed, And the whistling gypsy rover.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: He came at last to a mansion fine, Down by the river Claydee; And there was music, and there was wine, For the gypsy and his lady.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: "O, father he's no gypsy free, But lord of these lands all over; And I will stay till my dying day, With my whistling gypsy rover."
